// // Avighnam astu // // kiraṇa viyattiḥ candraghniḥ, dvijodaḥ ka:vi marutaraḥ, nahan· bhyakta pinakaśarira bhaṭāra, mmilv aja:nma gave bhuvaṇa sira ta:ṣṭatanun ṅaranira, sira ta:ṣṭadeśomidәṙ pinakavәṅku, sira ta huripnikaṁ rat·, sira dumadyakәn· vr̥ddhiniṁ janma
beḥ, praṇapraṇī saṙvva hurip·, Ikanaṅ hurip· lavan avak·, śarira pamiṣanya ri sadha:radeṣa, gumavay ikaṁ saṙvvadadi, sira sinaṅguḥ purvvaniṁ janma Umijil taṅ a:ṣṭatanu rat·, nara mr̥gha paśu janma stavara, pakṣi śarīśr̥pa miṇa, prabhavaniṅ adharadeya prabhu ra:ma R̥ṣi tiga si⌈
ra, prammaṇa rī rat·, pakәnī bhuvaṇa, tuvī sira tan duḥka piś iki gurunī janma kabeḥ, linraranikiṁ candanira ṅkaṇa, sira tika śiddhaguru, sira haṣṭaga:ṇa gumavay īka vaṙtha sәk lumraḥ Ikaṅ akṣaropamavak·, Ika ta guru ṅaranya, yeki ta vinastu hurip·, ya sinaṅguḥ guru
laghu ya pinakamula canda, Avaknikaṁ guru laghu, lavan hurip masaṁyoga, Ummijil tikaṁ trigaṇa Adīnignikaṁ guru la:ghu, Aniga-ni⌈geṁ sagaṇa, yekaṣṭagaṇa ṅaranya, sama ha:byapare vaṙttha mvaṁ laku śloka nihanlen· // L̥ // sakveḥ saṁ sujana:dihaṙṣa hirikaṁ canda
: nihan kavruḥhi, tan mahyun· vruha rupaniṁ laghu lavan tika: sinaṅguḥ guru, bheddha:niṁ guru laghu yeṅtakna:mvaṁ huṅgvaniṁ hakṣara, sakveḥniṁ guru yeriṅә:nhilahi leka: yan ṣalaḥ kastanan· byaktani guru saṙvva diṙghgha taruṅa: saṁyogapa:ranṅәn·, lavan
n· svara: vatәk· vyañjana, E Ai, nahan anuṁ kayyatnakna len· hoho vkasni guru, vus meṅәt· pva kiterika: niyata yan· śotan ta dadya vacan· lviṙnī hakṣara gantuṅәn mapakne vakta mvaṅ aṅgantuṅa, saṁyoga:para śukṣmamaṇa śivaghni klepa lakṣmī kunaṁ, nda

ka // L̥ // lviṙniṁ saṁyogaparekki, kakyan-kakyan kakyan-kakvan·, kakran hanṅәn agantuṁ, kayatnakn i· tmәn·-tmәn· Antaḥpada: guru yati, kalavan ṣvara kamadya, diṙgha:-diṙgha: vattavatī, tavat· guru prasiddha ya diṙgha: taruṅa surahan·, visaṙjja lavann a
nahan ta sinaṅguḥ guru nihan ta śvara kamadya, A A I Ī U Ū E O, tan dadi muṅguḥ ri tṅaḥ, vvittan juga paknanya // L̥ // sampun īkaṁ prateka hikanaṁ guru dinləṅakәn·, nya:t ajaR̥n muvaḥ paḍulu riṁ guru laghu vuvusәn·, kveḥnya savargga muṅguh ikana vacan aniga-niga, ye
sipatīṅ akavi puṙvva nihan maka:ra ṅaranī guru tiga sagaṇa, laghu kunaṁ pan mәṇḍasani luṅguhi yaka:ragaṇa, yapvan ikaṁ raka:ragaṇa laghu maḍuḍuk i: tṅaḥ, hetunikaṁ śaka:raga ṇa matyәṅ aguru vkasan· vruḥ pva kita: taka:ra ṅaraniṁ laghu tpi kavurī, ja:tinikaṁ jaka:ragaṇa
juga baka:ragaṇa riṁ guru sira rumuhun·, na:karagaṇa tlv amaḍuluṙ tika: ya laghu karva saṁ guru pasaṅgahanīka śilagho,⌈ śeṣaniṅa ganeki vkasiṁ guru laghu vinuvus·, riṁ haji canda teki yan avas· śiva haji piturun·, saṁ R̥ṣi baṅśapatramanitaḥ sira tiki manatha
nya teka: śa kuR̥b umunī vunbunikahәn·, śaśaṅkaḥ śaṅkaḥ śaṅkara kuśakuśaḥ keśi tuśika, kuśa śreta krośaḥ kraniki kata sabdeṁ śikariṇi, śiki keśikesa: pr̥sa kuśika kesi kuśakuśa sane śunya śreni graṇa pisunane śriyasa niśa, vina:sa mva ma:śa daśadiśi śarat·
śika, śiva sambuḥ śula triśula śuśali vava śiva, śavaḥ vaṅśaḥ veśaḥ savari tivirakaśa śacaya kṣaṇa kṣiṇi kapakṣa lakṣmi ṣaṇas· haṅhәmma nidi, kagantuṅa gumantaṅeṅ ḍa ḍa kunaṁ ṣa pr̥tvitala, prahr̥ṣṭi parituṣṭa roṣa ruṣa koṣa kr̥ṣṇaḥ praṣa, ṣa kaṙsaṇa vr̥ṣṇiḥ vr̥̄ṣṭa ṣa lumaḥ ṣa pr̥tti

It could be read 'apus' as well, but after observing the paleographical pattern of the other script 'ya', then the reading ‘ya’ makes more sense. , brata:
japa ginlarani mamnuhi rat·, kalaṇa kḍik ika ya magunaṇikara sahana-hanaṇikeṁ rat· rakva: tan· ya:mabakti, ri yativara nihan ta:deṅkva natha talaṅkup·, śakaR̥para siddha:bhakti rī hyaṁ padha tyәṁ, mahakalusanire jro maliniṁ na:ma kumlab· sakveḥ ta mriḥ mataki-tha
ki kasantoṣan lvambәk·, Ayva prajña: kativas ika: tan aṅgva korurva, puṅguṁ gә:ṁṅәn tivas ati kaL̥L̥b· maṅkīn· klesa, yogyaṅa:mbәk· mr̥dhukaralalita gəgyәnta mriḥ vva nicca mitra sujana śakaR̥ṁ bhuddhinya tut·, tan maṅga yan padhu sujana paḍa crol · sa tyatut·, soThe 'taling' sign is written in the end of the 3th line, while the 'tarung' sign is in the 4th line.
